newsitem.title: JAPAN: Konami says moves U.S. business to new subsidiary.
newsitem.headline: Konami says moves U.S. business to new subsidiary.

text.p: Japanese software house Konami Co Ltd said on Thursday it had dissolved a wholly owned subsidiary in the United States and shifted its business to a new subsidiary set up earlier in the month.
The older U.S. subsidiary, Konami (America) Inc, had been ailing under an accumulated loss of $105 million, which exceeded stockholders' equity by $90 million, Konami said in a statement.
The loss was incurred after the firm wrote off excessive inventories at the end of February 1995, Konami said.

Konami said it expects to take a total special loss of 10.9 billion yen from dissolving the subsidiary. It said the impact of the loss would be limited as it had already earmarked a 10.5 billion yen reserve for loan and investment losses in the previous business business year, to March 31, 1995.
The new subsidiary, Konami of America Inc, would be capitalised at 10 million dollars, Konami said.
